Relates #383 #170 #164 - this is a lot of the ground work for credential update sessions and account onboarding. None of the API's are wired into the http front end yet, but pretty much everything except webauthn is there. Committing now since it's pretty clear I'm not gonna have this complete before the next release.

candidates.title: Bump paste from 1.0.6 to 1.0.7

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body:
Bumps [paste](https://github.com/dtolnay/paste) from 1.0.6 to 1.0.7.
Release notes

Sourced from paste's releases.

1.0.7

  • Parse unicode character literals, as in [<line_point_ '\u{63}' _to_point_a>] -> line_point_c_to_point_a (#78)
Commits
  • 76f2101 Release 1.0.7
  • e48dda7 Merge pull request #78 from dtolnay/hexchar
  • dbf1be1 Restore compatibility with rustc older than 1.52
  • d3d1c85 Parse unicode character literals
  • 9b5ae9d Merge pull request #77 from dtolnay/literals
  • fccf35a Add test of char, string, and raw string literals
  • d563004 Merge pull request #76 from dtolnay/quotes
  • d82aaea Strip only surrounding quotes of a literal
  • 657991e Merge pull request #75 from dtolnay/byteliteral
  • 28d2b03 Reject byte literal and byte string literal inside paste
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=paste&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=1.0.6&new-version=1.0.7)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

candidates.title: Use pkg-config to link against pam
candidates.body:
Some distros, such as nixos, require more than just '-lpam' to locate
the library. Adding a naive pkg-config invocation to the pam FFI
crate allows pam_kanidm to build on my system, where before this change it did not.



- [x] cargo fmt has been run
- [x] cargo clippy has been run
- [x] cargo test has been run and passes
- [ ] ~book chapter included (if relevant)~ not relevant
- [ ] ~design document included (if relevant)~ not relevant

candidates.title: Specifying MSRV in package now
candidates.body:
Instead of having specific build scripting for it, now we're using the [post-rust-1.56 ability to specify MSRV in `Cargo.toml`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-rust-version-field)

- [x] cargo fmt has been run
- [x] cargo clippy has been run
- [x] cargo test has been run and passes

Updated docs too.

candidates.title: Cleanup display output
candidates.body:
Fixes #652 - this cleans up how we setup the tracing log levels initially, and seperates user information with println/eprintln, and our logging. This way we can have user defined log levels via the env, and by default we can split things by stdout/stderr.

candidates.title: 106 auth concurrency
candidates.body:
Fixes #106 - Implements concurrency in authentication. This exposed a few minor issues in how we were handling async in auth functions, which will be important later once we implement remote-auth for trusts and read-only systems. This will improve auth throughput in high load situations, while retaining all the previous guarantees of softlocking over credentials. 

This was done in preparation for multi-credential auth and credential reset workflows to help me get a refresh of how this all fits together ^^; 

- [ x ] cargo fmt has been run
- [ x ] cargo clippy has been run
- [ x ] cargo test has been run and passes

candidates.title: 278 603 OIDC implementation
candidates.body:
This adds OIDC to Kanidm. This replaces our current oauth2 tokens with OIDC compatible ones, and supports the correct generation of the private key material. 

Fixes #278 
Fixes #603
